etymology.description: phonetic: 舁 (OC *la) + phonetic: 牙 (OC *ŋraː); both components are phonetic; closest to original form 𦥸.
etymology.interpretation: Two phonetic elements, 舁 and 牙, were combined to signal pronunciation in Old Chinese, giving a reading around *la/*ŋra. There is little to no semantic contribution from either part; early shapes like 𦥸 reflect this phonetic fusion.
etymology.simplification: Mainland simplification adopted the long-standing clerical/cursive variant 与 for 與 to reduce strokes and streamline the graph.

parts.english: to lift; carry on the shoulders

examples.chinese: 我与他一起去(我與他一起去)。
examples.english: I will go together with him.

examples.chinese: 她与老师讨论问题(她與老師討論問題)。
examples.english: She discusses the issue with the teacher.

examples.chinese: 猫与狗都很可爱(貓與狗都很可愛)。
examples.pinyin: Māo yǔ gǒu dōu hěn kě'ài.
examples.english: Cats and dogs are both very cute.
